abstract.p: Edwin S James letter on Harvey Araton's May 16 article on Indiana University basketball coach Bobby Knight recalls statement by Winston Churchill that universities should not become trade schools; photo

block.p: If one considers Winston Churchill's thoughts on the purpose of universities, the ''Toadies,'' faculty, students and the rest of the nation might well be shocked. Churchill so wisely wrote: ''The first duty of a university is to teach wisdom not trade, character not technicalities. Young people study at universities to achieve knowledge, not to learn a trade. We must learn to support ourselves, but we must also learn how to live.''

If one considers Winston Churchill's thoughts on the purpose of universities, the ''Toadies,'' faculty, students and the rest of the nation might well be shocked. Churchill so wisely wrote: ''The first duty of a university is to teach wisdom not trade, character not technicalities. Young people study at universities to achieve knowledge, not to learn a trade. We must learn to support ourselves, but we must also learn how to live.''

With the given trend in present-day American university education and now the decision by president of Indiana University to allow Bob Knight to continue after his appalling gyrations as a university coach, only edges toward the conviction that American universities are becoming trade schools with professional sports teams. Hardly what Churchill might have recommended. Pity!
EDWIN S. JAMES Rock Hill, S.C.
